definitions.definition: (a feeling of) not being certain about something, especially about how good or true it is:
examples: I'm having doubts about his ability to do the job.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that what you are saying is true or likely to happen:
examples: We will, no doubt, discuss these issues again at the next meeting.
Witnesses have cast doubt on the accused's innocence.

definitions.definition: If the future or success of someone or something is in doubt, it is unlikely to continue or to be successful:
examples: The future of the stadium is in doubt because of a lack of money.
She is without (a) doubt the best student I have ever taught.

definitions.definition: to not feel certain or confident about something or to think that something is not probable:
examples: I doubt whether/if I can finish the work on time.

definitions.definition: to not trust someone or believe what they say:
examples: He's never lied to me before, so I have no reason to doubt his word.
